job_details.Functieomschrijving:
For the TU/e HPC Lab, we are looking for a proactive, service-minded, and self-driven AI/ML Application Support Engineer who will help us build and professionalize this innovative service. Do you want to rise above yourself, in your profession, and as a person? Do you want to be challenged every day? At the TU/e, scientists and students continuously create the unthinkable. These creative minds expect you to offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today.

   You will closely work with researchers, students of all departments, and TU/e institutes as well as with industry partners. You have AI and HPC infrastructure engineering know-how, but your main focus and interest are on the application and workflow side. You will work in a team of highly motivated experts and can help us shape the future of our university, scientists, and students.

   The job entails:
     * Assisting researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI/HPC platforms, such as batch computing clusters (local clusters, SURF CPU/GPU clusters) and cloud infrastructure (like Azure and Rescale).
     * Working with researchers to understand and optimize their application (benchmarking, code optimization).
     * Optimizing application workflow (pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.) to make the best use of a given platform.
     * Benchmarking and administration/accounting of workloads.
     * Training and communication for end-users.
job_details.full_text:
AI/ML Application Support Engineer

For the TU/e HPC Lab, we are looking for a proactive, service-minded, and self-driven AI/ML Application Support Engineer who will help us build and professionalize this innovative service. Do you want to rise above yourself, in your profession, and as a person? Do you want to be challenged every day? At the TU/e, scientists and students continuously create the unthinkable. These creative minds expect you to offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today.

   You will closely work with researchers, students of all departments, and TU/e institutes as well as with industry partners. You have AI and HPC infrastructure engineering know-how, but your main focus and interest are on the application and workflow side. You will work in a team of highly motivated experts and can help us shape the future of our university, scientists, and students.

   The job entails:
     * Assisting researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI/HPC platforms, such as batch computing clusters (local clusters, SURF CPU/GPU clusters) and cloud infrastructure (like Azure and Rescale).
     * Working with researchers to understand and optimize their application (benchmarking, code optimization).
     * Optimizing application workflow (pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.) to make the best use of a given platform.
     * Benchmarking and administration/accounting of workloads.
     * Training and communication for end-users.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description emphasizes assisting researchers with deploying scientific workloads on AI/HPC platforms, optimizing application workflows, and benchmarking. While it mentions AI/ML, the core focus is on supporting the application and workflow side of existing platforms, rather than developing new predictive models or generative AI applications. The responsibilities align more closely with data engineering, application optimization, and operational support for existing infrastructure, which are key aspects of an ML Engineer role focused on productionizing and supporting models and workflows.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Optimizing application workflow (pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.)' directly relates to managing and optimizing the data pipeline and storage aspects of scientific workloads.
job_tasks.phrase: Optimizing application workflow (pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.)

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Working with researchers to understand and optimize their application (benchmarking, code optimization)' implies an understanding and potential optimization of the underlying models or algorithms used in scientific applications, even if not explicitly building new ones.
job_tasks.phrase: Working with researchers to understand and optimize their application (benchmarking, code optimization)

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Assisting researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI/HPC platforms' involves supporting the deployment and integration of applications within existing infrastructure, which touches upon software deployment aspects.
job_tasks.phrase: Assisting researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI/HPC platforms

job_tasks.justification: The phrases 'Assisting researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI/HPC platforms, such as batch computing clusters (local clusters, SURF CPU/GPU clusters) and cloud infrastructure (like Azure and Rescale)' and 'Benchmarking and administration/accounting of workloads' directly relate to the operational aspects of managing and maintaining AI/HPC infrastructure and workloads.
job_tasks.phrase: Assisting researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI/HPC platforms, such as batch computing clusters (local clusters, SURF CPU/GPU clusters) and cloud infrastructure (like Azure and Rescale)

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Benchmarking and administration/accounting of workloads' falls under the operational management and monitoring of computational resources and their usage.

The phrase 'Training and communication for end-users' indicates a need to understand the users' needs and communicate technical information effectively, aligning with business understanding and user support.

soft_skills.phrase: You will closely work with researchers, students of all departments, and TU/e institutes as well as with industry partners.
Do you want to rise above yourself, in your profession, and as a person? Do you want to be challenged every day?
help us build and professionalize this innovative service.
offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today.
help us shape the future of our university, scientists, and students.
